intro: Solenanthus eriocalycinus, commonly known as the silky solenanthus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to cream in color, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
